para.heading: Vesting under previous District of Columbia retirement program.
para.text: For purposes of vesting pursuant to § 1-626.10(b), creditable service with the District for employees whose participation in the District Defined Contribution Plan ceases as a result of the implementation of the Balanced Budget Act of 1997 shall include:
continuous service performed by nonjudicial employees of the District of Columbia courts after September 30, 1997; and

service performed for a successor employer, including the Department of Justice or the District of Columbia Offender Supervision, Defender, and Courts Services Agency established under § 24-133, that provides services previously performed by the District government.

para.heading: Database.
para.text: The District of Columbia Child and Family Services Agency (referred to as “CFSA”) shall maintain an accurate database listing and tracking any child found by the Family Division of the District of Columbia Superior Court to be abused or neglected and who is in the custody of the District of Columbia, including any child with the goal of adoption or legally free for adoption.

annoGroup.heading: Short Title
annoGroup.annotation: District of Columbia Adoption Improvement Act of 1998: Section 157(a) of Pub. L. 105-277, 112 Stat. 2681-146, provided that the subchapter may be cited as the “District of Columbia Adoption Improvement Act of 1998.”

para.heading: Private contracts. —
para.text: Not later than September 30, 1999, CFSA shall enter into contracts with private service providers to perform some of the adoption recruitment and placement functions of CFSA, which may include recruitment, homestudy, and placement services.

para.heading: Competitive bidding. —
para.text: Any contract entered into pursuant to subsection (a) of this section shall be subject to a competitive bidding process when required by CFSA contracting policies and procedures.

para.heading: In general. —
para.text: Any contract entered into pursuant to subsection (a) of this section shall compensate the winning bidder pursuant to subsection (b) of this section upon completion of contract deliverables.

para.heading: Contract deliverables. —
para.text: In identifying contract deliverables, CFSA shall consider:
In the case of recruitment, receipt of a list of potential adoptive families;
In the case of homestudies, receipt of a completed home-study in a form specified in advance by CFSA; or
In the case of placements, the child is placed in an adoptive home approved by CFSA or the adoption is finalized.

para.heading: Types of contracts. —
para.text: Nothing in this section shall be construed to prevent CFSA from entering into contracts that provide for multiple deliverables or conditions for partial payment.

para.heading: Removal of barriers to adoption. —
para.text: CFSA shall meet with contractors to address issues identified during the term of a contract entered into pursuant to this subchapter, including issues related to barriers to timely adoptions.
